intro: Drepananthus longiflorus, commonly known as the long-flowered hookweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its seeds are enclosed in small, three-lobed capsules, which are dispersed by wind. Drepananthus longiflorus is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
